content:
I don't think we have a github repo yet for organizing the project but I think our first task should be deciding on a process for the error handling project group will be managed. I'm not sure if other projects have norms that we can look into so if anyone knows of examples that would be useful context for us.

My inclination is to setup a readme for the project group repo outlining how the project is managed, mostly covering things like when meetings are, some sort of progress tracker, and explanations for how to get involved.

my preference for meetings would be to have meetings once every week or two, and depending on what time zones the participants are in we might want to have two times that the meetings alternate between so we can accomidate different time zones
I'm mostly using wg-traits as the basis for how I'd like project-error-handling to work
@Jane Lusby I don't know if you saw the team repo PR, once that merges, I can add you to the repo
(I prefer to only add teams not people)

simulacrum said:

(I prefer to only add teams not people)

makes sense
it should create the github team shortly...
@Jane Lusby okay should have write access
let me know if you need me to do anything else
will do, ty @simulacrum, I extremely appreciate how promptly you got this all setup for us
This all sounds great. I am in London time but should be available till 2-3PM PST most days.
I don't think we will be as fast moving to demand weekly reviews, once in 2 weeks sounds good to me :smile:
i've gone ahead and created a doodle for the week starting 29.09 (2 weeks from now): https://doodle.com/poll/fkmvqvpq6eu68igi
awesome, ty @DPC. I've gone ahead and added my availability
